title: [Neuroscience] Scientists xenografted human neurons into mouse brains containing amyloid plaques. The human neurons, but not the mouse neurons, developed severe Alzheimer’s pathology. Down-regulation of MEG3 protected the human neurons from dying, suggesting a new therapeutic approach for Alzheimer’s disease.
[Health] Cold-stimulated brown adipose tissue activation is related to changes in serum metabolites relevant to NAD+ metabolism in humans (Sept 2023)
